job_description: Description AFCC requires a coop to work within the Stack System Interface Team to carry out design studies, experiments, and develop models.The successful candidate will:• Write and/or improve existing dynamic models using Matlab/Simulink• Support interface requirements (stack to powertrain), refine measurement techniques, run fuel cell sensitivity tests in the laboratory, and provide literature reviews on special topics• Support cascade of design requirements to the Fuel Cell Stack Components and management of interfaces between Fuel Cell Stack components.• Collect test data, perform data analysis (including fuel cell system data), prepare charts and write summary reports• Support prototype build and tests (including building special test fixtures)RequiredNSERC Eligible
job_requirements: Requirements/Skills Key job skills include:• Knowledge of mechanical or chemical  engineering principles at an intermediate level (Year 2 or 3)• Experience with Matlab and Simulink, including writing M-code scripts, and building and running Simulink models.• Experience with MS Word, Excel , data analysis, and report writing• Basic understanding of electrical engineering• Good oral and written communication skillsAreas of Study Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electro-Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Materials EngineeringAFCC values diversity in the workplace and is committed to Employment Equity.  We encourage applications from all qualified candidates.Open To All Majors:No
